author: DistroTube
description:
The Dead Internet Theory—once dismissed as paranoid speculation—has begun to look less like a conspiracy and more like a blueprint for our digital age. The theory suggests that much of what we see online today is not organic human activity, but content generated by bots, AI, and a handful of corporations shaping discourse, or possibly the work of government agencies.
